verses.name: Proverbs 6:6
verses.text: Go to the ant, thou sluggard; consider her ways, and be wise:

verses.name: Proverbs 6:7
verses.text: Which having no guide, overseer, or ruler,

verses.name: Proverbs 6:8
verses.text: Provideth her meat in the summer, and gathereth her food in the harvest.

verses.name: Proverbs 6:9
verses.text: How long wilt thou sleep, O sluggard? when wilt thou arise out of thy sleep?

verses.name: Proverbs 6:10
verses.text: Yet a little sleep, a little slumber, a little folding of the hands to sleep:

verses.name: Proverbs 6:11
verses.text: So shall thy poverty come as one that travelleth, and thy want as an armed man.

verses.name: Proverbs 6:12
verses.text: A naughty person, a wicked man, walketh with a froward mouth.
